description: This is an "All-Backyard" project - all data from my bortle class 9 backyard under the moon, including Ha, S-II, O-III and R/G/B star layers. It took 7 nights to collect all the data for this project. It's quite unusual - one whole week with clear night sky. Right after I failed miserably trying to capture some data for the SH2-129/Ou4. Now I do admit that some targets are not practical for backyarders. Learned quite a lot from imaging and processing the RGB stars. Intentionally, the stars are decreased a lot to expose more nebulosity. Three versions are made and uploaded - star spikes, no spikes and no stars. Don't know why one is better. Comments are welcome! Thinking about Western Veil as the next target. Pre-processing of Narrowband Masters - Calibration / Integration, Astro Pixel Processor - Deconvolution, PixInsight (Only for H-Alpha) - MultiscaleLinearTransformation (Denoise), PixInsight - ScreenTransferFunction / HistogramTransformation, PixInsight. Pre-processing of RGB Masters - Calibration / Integration, Astro Pixel Processor - Dynamic Background Extraction, PixInsight - MorphologicalTransformation, PixInsight - ScreenTransferFunction / HistogramTransformation, PixInsight. RGB Combination - LRGBCombination, PixInsight - MorphologicalTransformation, PixInsight - ScreenTransferFunction / HistogramTransformation, PixInsight. Narrowband Combination - PixelMath, PixInsight - ScreenTransferFunction / HistogramTransformation, PixInsight. Narrband & RGB Combination - Star adjustment, Lightroom - Final Touch-up, Photoshop
title: Dark Molecular Cloud in NGC 7000
